translation: In the year of Zongguan, Tang Dynasty, Xuanzang translated the Yakushi Lapis Light Sutra at Cien Temple (thirteen pages; the commentaries of the world are doubtful); Huijian translated the Yakushi Rulai Benyuan jing (twelve pages); Jado translated the Yakushi Rulai Benyuan gongde sutra at Shanglin Park in Dongdu in the year of Daiye (twelve pages; the upper three scriptures are the same as the original variant translation).

translation: In the year of Xianqing of the Tang Dynasty, Xuanzang translated the Sutra of the Collection of the Great Vehicle (ten volumes, two hundred and twenty pages, made by the Bodhisattva of Non-Nature). In the year of Yonghui of the Tang Dynasty, Xuanzang translated the Sutra of the Bodhisattva's Abhidharma Collection (seven volumes, one hundred and eighteen pages).
Great Tang Collection of Buddhist Texts, Volume 6
